title: How to Take a Screen Shot (Screen Capture)

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+PrintScreen to save the screenshot directly to a file.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + PrintScreen to save the screenshot directly to a file. The "PrintScreen" button may be abbreviated (i.e "prt sc" or similar). This will save you from having to paste it into a separate app. The file will be located in the "Screenshots" folder inside your "Pictures" folder. If this folder does not exist, it will be created automatically. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Press Alt+⊞ Win+PrintScreen to take a screenshot of the active window only.
steps.content: Press Alt + ⊞ Win + PrintScreen to take a screenshot of the active window only. The "PrintScreen" button may be abbreviated (i.e "prt sc" or similar). The active window is whichever window is displayed on top on your desktop display. It's also the app that's highlighted in the taskbar at the bottom. All apps running in the background will not be included in the screen capture image. Images will be saved to the "Capture" folder in the "Videos" folder.

steps.title: Take a full-screen screenshot in Windows 7 or Vista.
steps.content: Take a full-screen screenshot in Windows 7 or Vista. To do so, press the Print Screen button. It may be abbreviated (i.e "prt sc"). It is typically located in the top row of the keyboard towards the right side. You may need to press the Function or Fn key if you're using a laptop. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The image will be copied to the clipboard. This means that the image data will need to be pasted in an image editing program such as Paint or Photoshop . To paste the image, press Ctrl + V .

steps.title: Press press ⌘ Command+⇧ Shift+3 to take a full-screen screenshot.
steps.content: Press press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 3 to take a full-screen screenshot . This takes a picture of the entire screen. The computer will make the sound of a camera shutter. [3] X Research source By default, screenshots will be saved to your desktop. If you’d rather copy the screenshot to your clipboard instead of saving it to a file, press Command + Control + Shift + 3 . Instead of saving the image as a JPEG file, the image data will be copied. You'll need to paste it into an image editor such as Adobe Photoshop, GIMP or Preview.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+⇧ Shift+4 to capture part of your display.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 4 to capture part of your display. The pointer will turn into a crosshair. Drag the crosshairs to create a box around the area of the screen you want to capture. [4] X Research source f

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+⇧ Shift+4+Spacebar to capture a specific window.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 4 + Spacebar to capture a specific window. The cursor will become a camera icon. Click the window in which you want a screenshot. When you click, the computer will make a "shutter" sound and the image will be saved to a file on your desktop. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+⇧ Shift+5 or use LaunchPad to open Screenshot.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 5 or use LaunchPad to open Screenshot. This method works for macOS Mojave 10.14 and later versions. Here you can choose to capture the full screen, selected window, or selected portion freely. Moreover, You can press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 6 to capture the Touch Bar on Mac. The captured image will be saved on the desktop in the PNG format by default. [6] X Research source 4

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Show Windows to screenshot the entire screen.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Show Windows to screenshot the entire screen. This takes a screenshot of everything displayed on your screen. The "Show Windows" button is the button that has an icon that resembles a computer screen with two lines to the right. It's in the center of the top row of the keyboard.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+Ctrl+Show Windows to take a partial screenshot.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + Ctrl + Show Windows to take a partial screenshot. The screen will darken slightly. Click and drag the mouse cursor over the area you want to take a screenshot of. Then press Enter or click Copy to Clipboard if you'd rather copy the screenshot. You can select more screenshot features from the toolbar. [7] X Research source The "Show Windows" button is the button that has an icon that resembles a computer screen with two lines to the right. It's in the center of the top row of the keyboard.

steps.title: Press the Power button and the Volume Down button to take a screenshot on a tablet.
steps.content: Press the Power button and the Volume Down button to take a screenshot on a tablet. If your Chromebook is a tablet, you can take a screenshot of the entire screen by pressing the Power Button and Volume Down button at the same time. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click the notification.
steps.content: Click the notification. A notification appears after you take a screenshot. Click it to view the screenshot. Alternatively, you can find your screenshots in the Files app. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the screen you want to capture.
steps.content: Go to the screen you want to capture. Find the image, picture, message, website, etc., of which you want to take a picture.

steps.title: Press the button combination for your iPhone or iPad model.
steps.content: Press the button combination for your iPhone or iPad model. Each iPhone and iPad model has a specific combination of buttons you need to press at the same time to take a screenshot. The button combination varies from one iPhone model to another. The screen will flash indicating a screenshot has been taken. Use one of the following button combinations: [10] X Research source [11] X Research source iPhone with Face ID: Press the Side button and the Volume Up button at the same time. [12] X Research source iPhone with a Home button: Press the Home button and the Side button or Wake/Sleep button at the same time. The Side button is on the right side of the phone. The Wake/Sleep button is on the top-right shoulder. iPad without a Home button: Press the Top button and Volume Up button at the same time. iPad with a Home button: Press the Home button and Top button at the same time.

steps.title: Open the Photos app.
steps.content: Open the Photos app. It has an icon that resembles a colorful flower.

steps.title: Tap Albums.
steps.content: Tap Albums . It's in the lower-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap the Screenshots album.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap the Screenshots album. The image you just captured will be the last image at the bottom of the album.

steps.title: Go to the screen you want to capture.
steps.content: Go to the screen you want to capture. Find the image, picture, message, website, etc., of which you want to take a picture.

steps.title: Press the Power and Volume-Down buttons at the same time.
steps.content: Press the Power and Volume-Down buttons at the same time. The screen will flash to indicate the screenshot. [13] X Research source On Samsung Galaxy devices with a Home button, press the Power button and the Home button at the same time. You can also take a screenshot by swiping your hand from left to right on the screen. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Gallery app.
steps.content: Open the Gallery app. It generally has an icon that resembles a photograph. Tap the Gallery icon on your Home screen to open the Gallery.

steps.title: Tap the Screenshots folder.
steps.content: Tap the Screenshots folder. This is the folder that all your screenshots are saved to.
